```{r}
library(rliesel)
y <- rnorm(10)

mod <- liesel(
  response = y,
  distribution = "Normal",
  predictors = list(
    loc = predictor(~1, inverse_link = "Identity"),
    scale = predictor(~1, inverse_link = "Exp")
  )
)
```

```{python}
import jax.numpy as jnp
import liesel.model as lsl
import liesel.goose as gs

jnp.array(1.0) + jnp.array(1.0)
```
